monster.name: Beholder Eye of Flame

trait.name: Vulnerability Cone
entries: The beholder's central eye creates an area of fire vulnerability in a 150-foot cone. All creatures within the cone gain vulnerability to fire. At the start of each of its turns, the beholder decides which way the cone faces and whether the cone is active.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the beholder or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage plus 14  ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates, except for Flame Ray), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it.
1-2. Flame Ray. The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 44 ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage. or half as much damage on a successful save.

3. Fear Ray. The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

4. Telekinetic Ray. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is {@condition incapacitated}.

If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

legendaryHeader: The beholder can take 3 legendary actions, using the Eye Ray option below. It can take only one legendary action at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The beholder regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

legendary.name: Eye Ray
entries: The beholder uses one random eye ray.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

bonus.name: Jump
entries: The spider's long jump is up to 40 feet and its high jump is up to 20 feet when it has a running start.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

bonus.name: Spit Venom {@recharge 5}
entries: As a bonus action on your turn, the spider spits venom at an enemy. {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

reaction.name: Shield
entries: You can use your reaction to have the spider shield you or an ally within 10ft from an attack. If so, the spider takes half the damage from the attack.
